intro: Centaurea spinosa f. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its spiny, upright stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces purple to pinkish-red flower heads that are typically arranged in a conical shape. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. This subspecies is distinguished by its reduced leaf hair compared to the typical form, giving it a smoother appearance.
